intro: Lysionotus gamosepalus, commonly known as the golden star flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive star-shaped appearance. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth surface and a slightly hairy texture. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects.
